goal.ch:
「運動健康與社會福祉」，關注於普遍存在於當代社會的精神憂鬱議題，阮啟弘講座教授以腦科學的理論基礎出發，介紹精神疾病與腦的關聯。吳治翰助理教授從運動員訓練以及運動心理學的學理觀點，介紹運動帶來的心理變化。張家凱助理教授以資通訊技術(人工智慧、物聯網、雲端大數據)介紹穿戴式裝置的生理訊號追蹤與雲端資料庫資料視覺化。探討台灣精神醫療的城鄉差距，並以腦科學為基礎、以運動為手段、以資通訊技術為輔助工具，帶領學生嘗試解決因城鄉差距造成的精神醫療不平等現象，規劃一個能讓精神醫療社會福祉較平等的實踐藍圖。

本課程以人文、社會、理工機電等學院學生為主，資訊學生為輔所設計。具體之教學目標包含：
(一)了解精神健康的基本概念及其社會影響：學生將學習關於精神疾病的基本知識，特別是憂鬱症及焦慮症，並了解這些問題在現代社會中的普遍性及其對個人和社會的影響；
(二)探討運動對心理健康的正面影響：通過學習運動心理學的理論及實證研究，學生將理解如何透過運動改善心理健康，並能夠將這些知識應用於設計適合不同群體的運動方案；
(三)學習穿戴式裝置及資通訊技術在健康管理中的應用：學生將掌握如何使用穿戴式裝置來追蹤生理和心理數據，並學習雲端資料庫的數據視覺化技術，以進行健康數據的分析和解讀；
(四)培養跨領域協作能力：本課程鼓勵來自不同學科背景的學生進行跨領域合作，促進團隊合作能力的發展，以達成共同的課題研究和解決實際問題。
goal.en:
“Sports Health and Social Welfare“ focuses on the prevalent issue of mental depression in contemporary society. Professor Ruan Qihong introduces the correlation between mental illness and the brain based on the theoretical foundation of neuroscience. Assistant Professor Wu Zhihan presents the psychological changes brought about by exercise from the perspectives of athlete training and sports psychology. Assistant Professor Zhang Jiakai discusses the physiological signal tracking of wearable devices and cloud database data visualization using information and communication technology (artificial intelligence, Internet of Things, cloud big data). The discussions explore the urban-rural gap in mental healthcare in Taiwan, and with a foundation in neuroscience, utilizing exercise as a means and information and communication technology as an auxiliary tool, the course guides students to attempt to address the inequalities in mental healthcare caused by urban-rural disparities, planning a practical blueprint for more equitable social welfare in mental healthcare.

This course is designed primarily for students from the humanities, social sciences, and engineering disciplines, with a supplementary focus on information technology students. The specific teaching objectives include:
1. Understanding the Basic Concepts of Mental Health and Its Social Impact: Students will learn fundamental knowledge about mental illnesses, particularly depression and anxiety, and understand the prevalence of these issues in modern society and their impacts on individuals and society.
2. Exploring the Positive Effects of Exercise on Mental Health: Through studying theories and empirical research in sports psychology, students will understand how exercise can improve mental health and will be able to apply this knowledge to design exercise programs suitable for different groups.
3. Learning the Applications of Wearable Devices and Information and Communication Technology in Health Management: Students will master the use of wearable devices to track physiological and psychological data, and learn data visualization techniques for cloud databases to analyze and interpret health data.
4. Cultivating Interdisciplinary Collaboration Skills: This course encourages students from different academic backgrounds to collaborate across disciplines, fostering the development of teamwork skills to achieve common research objectives and solve practical problems.

outline.ch:
【請留意】
本課程第一週為遠距上課，Webex網址：https://ncu-edu.webex.com/meet/ckchang
各週課程介紹：
1. 課程介紹與背景概述
本課程第一週為遠距上課，Webex網址：https://ncu-edu.webex.com/meet/ckchang
課程介紹、學習目標與評分方式說明
精神健康的重要性及當前社會的相關議題
運動、健康與社會福祉的關聯
2. 精神健康的基本概念與社會影響
精神疾病的基本概念（焦慮症、憂鬱症等）
台灣精神健康的現況與挑戰
社會福祉與精神健康
3. 精神健康與運動的國際視野
各國精神健康與運動醫療的現況
台灣與國際精神醫療模式比較
城鄉差距對精神醫療的影響
4. 精神醫療的城鄉差距
台灣精神醫療資源的分布現況
城鄉差距帶來的健康不平等現象
改善城鄉精神醫療差距的策略與建議
5. 腦科學與精神健康的連結
大腦結構與功能
精神疾病與大腦的關聯性
跨顱磁刺激療法與正念療法的原理介紹
6. 運動心理學概論
運動心理學的基本理論
運動對心理健康的正面影響
心理健康與運動的實證研究
7. 運動與正念訓練
正念訓練的概念與原理
正念對運動表現與心理健康的影響
運動心理學的最新研究進展
8. 期中專題提案
期中專題提案提交與學生報告
含生成式AI深度知識追蹤的專題設計
個別與小組提案討論與回饋
9. 穿戴式裝置與健康數據追蹤
穿戴式裝置的種類與應用
生理與心理數據的收集與監測
健康數據視覺化技術
10. 資通訊技術在健康管理中的應用
物聯網技術與雲端大數據簡介
健康管理中的數據分析與解讀
健康數據的視覺化展示
11. 腦科學技術的應用實例
跨顱電刺激與磁刺激技術的案例研究
腦波監測技術的實際應用
心理治療與運動療法的結合應用
12. 運動方案設計與實踐
針對不同人群的運動方案設計原則
運動方案的個案研究與實施
運動對特殊人群（如老年人、兒童、慢性病患者）的影響
13. 健康數據視覺化實作
使用穿戴式裝置收集健康數據
健康數據的視覺化處理與展示
進行資料分析，提出可視化結果
14. 精神健康改善計劃的設計
以腦科學與運動心理學為基礎的干預計劃設計
針對社會福祉不平等現象的解決方案討論
利用生成式AI進行深度知識追蹤與計劃優化
15. 期末專題報告初步分享
小組專題報告初步分享與反饋
組內協作與生成式AI支援的專題進展
專題的改進建議
16. 期末小組專題報告
期末專題報告提交與展示
使用生成式AI的知識追蹤評估
小組報告的評分與回饋
分組實作成果之要求與說明：
1. 成果形式：小組
2. 數位技能呈現：物聯網資通訊與雲端大數據串接處理、數據分析與資料視覺化
3. 人文內涵：精神健康、運動等會社會福祉議題探討
4. 評分指標、機制與比例：資料視覺效果(30％)、資料分析能力(40％)、結論與建言(30％)
5. 補充：鼓勵參加競賽，實踐社會關懷議題
outline.en:
【Please Note】
The first week of this course will be conducted remotely. The link of Webex：https://ncu-edu.webex.com/meet/ckchang
Weekly Course Introduction:
1. Course Introduction and Background Overview
- The first week will be conducted remotely. The link is: https://meet.google.com/wyv-bgdo-xnj
- Introduction to the course, learning objectives, and grading methods.
- The importance of mental health and relevant issues in contemporary society.
- The connection between sports, health, and social welfare.
2. Basic Concepts of Mental Health and Social Impact
- Basic concepts of mental illness (anxiety disorders, depression, etc.).
- Current status and challenges of mental health in Taiwan.
- Social welfare and mental health.
3. International Perspectives on Mental Health and Exercise
- The current status of mental health and sports medicine in various countries.
- Comparison of Taiwan‘s and international mental health care models.
- The impact of urban-rural disparities on mental health care.
4. Urban-Rural Disparities in Mental Health Care
- Current distribution of mental health resources in Taiwan.
- Health inequalities caused by urban-rural disparities.
- Strategies and recommendations for improving urban-rural mental health care disparities.
5. The Connection Between Neuroscience and Mental Health
- Brain structure and function.
- The correlation between mental illness and the brain.
- Introduction to transcranial magnetic stimulation therapy and mindfulness therapy principles.
6. Introduction to Sports Psychology
- Basic theories of sports psychology.
- The positive effects of exercise on mental health.
- Empirical research on mental health and exercise.
7. Exercise and Mindfulness Training
- Concepts and principles of mindfulness training.
- The impact of mindfulness on exercise performance and mental health.
- Latest research advancements in sports psychology.
8. Midterm Project Proposal
- Submission and student presentations of midterm project proposals.
- Project design incorporating generative AI deep knowledge tracking.
- Discussion and feedback on individual and group proposals.
9. Wearable Devices and Health Data Tracking
- Types and applications of wearable devices.
- Collection and monitoring of physiological and psychological data.
- Health data visualization techniques.
10. Applications of Information and Communication Technology in Health Management
- Introduction to IoT technology and cloud big data.
- Data analysis and interpretation in health management.
- Visualization of health data.
11. Applications of Neuroscience Technologies
- Case studies of transcranial electrical stimulation and magnetic stimulation technologies.
- Practical applications of brainwave monitoring technology.
- Combining psychotherapy with exercise therapy.
12. Design and Implementation of Exercise Programs
- Principles for designing exercise programs for different populations.
- Case studies and implementation of exercise programs.
- The impact of exercise on specific populations (e.g., elderly, children, chronic patients).
13. Implementation of Health Data Visualization
- Collecting health data using wearable devices.
- Visualization processing and presentation of health data.
- Conducting data analysis and presenting visualization results.
14. Design of Mental Health Improvement Plans
- Designing intervention plans based on neuroscience and sports psychology.
- Discussion of solutions for social welfare inequalities.
- Utilizing generative AI for deep knowledge tracking and plan optimization.
15. Initial Sharing of Final Project Reports
- Preliminary sharing and feedback on group project reports.
- Collaborative progress supported by generative AI.
- Suggestions for project improvement.
16. Final Group Project Report
- Submission and presentation of final project reports.
- Evaluation of knowledge tracking using generative AI.
- Grading and feedback on group reports.
Requirements and Explanations for Group Project Outcomes:
1. Outcome Format: Group work.
2. Digital Skills Presentation: IoT communication and cloud big data integration, data analysis, and visualization.
3. Humanistic Content: Exploration of mental health, exercise, and social welfare issues.
4. Grading Criteria, Mechanism, and Proportions: Visual effects of data (30％), data analysis capability (40％), conclusions and recommendations (30％).
5. Additional Note: Participation in competitions is encouraged to address social welfare issues.

textbook.ch:
1. 競技與健身運動心理學（五版）(ISBN：9786269747658)
2. 健康、疾病與醫療：醫療社會學新論 (ISBN：9789571459950)
3. 運動生理學（五版）(ISBN：9786269747627)
4. Python機器學習(第二版) (ISBN: 9789864343324)
5. 精通機器學習：使用Scikit-Learn, Keras與TensorFlow 第二版 (ISBN: 9789865024345)
6. 打造機器學習應用｜從構想邁向產品 (ISBN: 9789865027582)
7. 精通 Python｜運用簡單的套件進行現代運算 (ISBN：9789865024864)
textbook.en:
1. Competitive and Fitness Sports Psychology (5th Edition) (ISBN: 9786269747658)
2. Health, Illness, and Medical Care: New Perspectives in Medical Sociology (ISBN: 9789571459950)
3. Exercise Physiology (5th Edition) (ISBN: 9786269747627)
4. Python Machine Learning (2nd Edition) (ISBN: 9789864343324)
5. Mastering Machine Learning: Using Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow (2nd Edition) (ISBN: 9789865024345)
6. Building Machine Learning Applications: From Idea to Product (ISBN: 9789865027582)
7. Mastering Python: Modern Computing with Simple Packages (ISBN: 9789865024864)

gradMethod.ch:
1. 期中個人專題提案(含生成式AI深度知識追蹤)：30％
2. 期末小組專題報告(含生成式AI深度知識追蹤)：40％
3. 生成式AI口試：20％
4. 社群議題討論：10％
gradMethod.en:
1. Midterm Individual Project Proposal (including generative AI deep knowledge tracking): 30％
2. Final Group Project Report (including generative AI deep knowledge tracking): 40％
3. Generative AI Oral Exam: 20％
4. Community Issue Discussion: 10％
